Before you take on any fiends, there are a few things you should remember. First, always have weapons and armor equipped, and spells memorized from scrolls.<Prompt>
Second, always  check  your target before engaging it. Never take on a foe that seems too strong for you to defeat alone.<Prompt>
Third, when you are in a party, make it a habit to cast lots for your share of the party  spoils  after successfully defeating a monster.<Prompt>
Some people in town will ask you to do certain tasks for them. These are called  quests.  Complete them, and they should reward you for your efforts.<Prompt>
There are also tasks you can do for your country, known as  missions.  There is a guard at each gate charged with assigning them. Speak to the guards for more details.<Prompt>

What do you wish to know about. <Selection Dialog>Nothing. Conquests. Conquest results. Donating crystals. Conquest points. The effects of controlling regions. Regions controlled by other nations. Regions under beastman control.<Prompt>

All three nations are striving daily to put more regions under their control. This is what we call  conquests.  You can take part in it and serve your country by defeating enemies while you have Signet cast on you.<Prompt>
Each region comprises several areas, and the nation that rids those areas of the most monsters gains control of the region.<Prompt>
Nations receive goods and resources from regions under their control.<Prompt>
So, the more regions we control, the richer our nation becomes.<Prompt>
Border guards are also placed in outposts within regions under our control. They are there to cast Signet on adventurers like yourself.<Prompt>
Once you have your nation's Signet, you will be able to acquire crystals from enemies you defeat.<Prompt>

Not only that, but you will also receive conquest points. You get more conquest points if you defeat enemies in regions that are not under your nation's control. These points can be used to purchase items from guards like myself.<Prompt>
So you see...conquests benefit nations and adventurers alike. We expect you to do your best to serve your country.<Prompt>

You can see the current state of conquests by selecting  Region Info  from the main menu. Conquest results in all regions are regularly recalculated, so you may want to check them from time to time.<Prompt>
Shops in our city will be selling different items according to our conquest rank. The Troupe Valeriano will also visit the nation that finishes first and bring a little joy to its citizens.<Prompt>

You can purchase items from guards like myself with your conquest points, but be warned that the number of points you spend will be subtracted from your current total.<Prompt>

When conquest results are announced, you will be told which country controls the region you are in at that time. Sometimes regions may become neutral, or beastmen may even gain control of regions.<Prompt>
If we gain control of a region, border guards will be placed at its outposts to help adventurers like you.<Prompt>

The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:<Prompt>
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of  Flammen-Brenner. <Prompt>
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with  Flamme,  or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.<Prompt>
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.<Prompt>
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.<Prompt>
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.<Prompt>
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The  match score  section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.<Prompt>
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.<Prompt>
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.<Prompt>
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.<Prompt>

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed <Numeric (Parameter 0)> members, or if there are fewer than <Numeric (Parameter 1)> members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.<Prompt>
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The <Set colour #5>Master of Ceremonies<Set colour #1> (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.<Prompt>
LS Liga  is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.<Prompt>
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.<Prompt>
The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.<Prompt>
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.<Prompt>
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.<Prompt>
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.<Prompt>
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.<Prompt>

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.<Prompt>

Like Ballista, <Set colour #5>quarry<Set colour #1> (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up <Set colour #5>Petras<Set colour #1> and temporary items.<Prompt>

However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can <Set colour #5>trade<Set colour #1> a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.<Prompt>
<Set colour #5>Sprint<Set colour #1> cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the <Set colour #5>scout<Set colour #1> ability cannot be used in Brenner.<Prompt>
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.<Prompt>
The <Set colour #5>sprint<Set colour #1> (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.<Prompt>
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.<Prompt>
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.<Prompt>

What would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>The Vana'diel Chocobo Society. Time required. Chocobo attributes. Care schedule. Caring for your chocobo. Feed. Abilities and personality. Retirement. Matchmaking. Calling chocobos in the field. Items. Lost chicks. Nothing.<Prompt>

The Vana'diel Chocobo Society, or VCS for short, is an international organization designed to train and dispatch chocogirls and chocoguys to stables across Vana'diel.<Prompt>
They provide courses on practical chocobo riding and the proper ways to care for a chocobo, as well as working to improve the treatment of chocobos from here to Aht Urhgan.<Prompt>
Anyone can join as long as they love chocobos. The VCS will help you with anything you need.<Prompt>
Chicks hatch from eggs, grow into young chocobos, and finally mature.<Prompt>
They grow much faster than people do. Usually it takes about 1 month (Earth time) before you can ride your chocobo.<Prompt>
The chocobo's traits are determined by the way in which you care for your animal. Without proper planning, you won't be able to raise the type of chocobo that you want.<Prompt>
But don't worry, because you have us to help! We're all in this together!<Prompt>
Ask about which attribute. <Selection Dialog>Strength. Endurance. Discernment. Receptivity. Energy. Affection. Satisfaction. Nothing.<Prompt>

Strength  is a term used to describe the chocobo's leg power. The more strength a chocobo has, the faster it will be able to run. Rental chocobos have been raised with an emphasis on this attribute.<Prompt>
Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as  Physical attributes. <Prompt>
Endurance  is a term used to describe the chocobo's stamina. If your chocobo has high endurance, you will be able to ride it for a long period of time.<Prompt>
Both strength and endurance are collectively referred to as  Physical attributes. <Prompt>
Discernment  is a must for anyone who wants their chocobo to learn new abilities. You may want to consider raising this attribute if you are interested in digging for treasure.<Prompt>
Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as  Mental attributes. <Prompt>

Receptivity  is a term used to describe the chocobo's sensitivity when dealing with others. You can foster receptivity in your chocobo by giving it lots of opportunities to communicate with other chocobos.<Prompt>
Both discernment and receptivity are collectively referred to as  Mental attributes. <Prompt>

Energy  is a term used to describe the amount of power the chocobo needs to stay active for the day. If your chocobo has a lot of energy, care plans are more likely to be successful and you can provide more direct care for your chocobo.<Prompt>
You can restore your chocobo's energy by feeding it, so remember not to skip out on feeding time after a demanding schedule!<Prompt>
Affection  is the most important attribute of all. Your care schedule will fall flat if you don't show your chocobo proper affection!<Prompt>
You can raise your chocobo's affection by feeding it greens and caring for it on a regular basis.<Prompt>

If you really want to raise your chocobo's affection quickly, you can give it <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , but I can't recommend doing so unless absolutely necessary.<Prompt>
Satisfaction  is a term used to describe how full or hungry your chocobo is. If your chocobo is full, it will gain a lot of energy before the next day.<Prompt>
However, when the chocobo is very hungry, its energy will hardly recover at all and its affection will rapidly decrease.<Prompt>

What would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>What is a care schedule. Basic care. Resting. Taking a walk. Listening to music. Exercising alone. Exercising in a group. Interacting with children. Interacting with chocobos. Carrying packages. Exhibiting to the public. Delivering messages. Digging for treasure. Acting in a play. Nothing.<Prompt>
A care schedule is a series of plans that you set up for your chocobo so that we can take care of it while you are away.<Prompt>
How you want us to care for your chocobo each day is completely up to you.<Prompt>
You can register up to four plans at once, each for up to 7 days (Earth time).<Prompt>
When you come to check on your chocobo, we will give you a report on the results. You should listen closely to the report and use it as reference when deciding on a new schedule.<Prompt>
With the basic care plan, we will provide the minimum level of care for your chocobo. This plan is the most stable, and your chocobo will probably not experience any sudden changes.<Prompt>
The basic care plan is good for those who don't want their chocobo's traits to change much or are still unsure of what kind of schedule to choose.<Prompt>
You can select the basic care plan the moment you start raising your chocobo.<Prompt>
The rest plan's name speaks for itself. We will give your chocobo a rest in order to restore its energy and cure any status abnormalities.<Prompt>
However, your chocobo will not be able to eat any food you give it during the plan, because it will be in a deep sleep.<Prompt>

We can take your chocobo for a walk in town to improve its physical attributes of strength and endurance. However, it will have a negative effect on its mental attributes of discernment and receptivity.<Prompt>
Listening to music will improve your chocobo's mental attributes of discernment and receptivity. However, it will have a negative effect on its physical attributes of strength and endurance.<Prompt>
Exercising alone will significantly improve your chocobo's strength. On the other hand, its mental attributes will markedly decrease.<Prompt>
If the chocobo is strong, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo is weak, then you shouldn't push it too hard.<Prompt>
Exercising with chocobos will build your animal's endurance. On the other hand, its mental attributes will decrease.<Prompt>
If the chocobo has high endurance, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo's endurance is low, then you shouldn't push it too hard.<Prompt>
Interacting with children helps your chocobo become a more discerning creature by interacting with people.<Prompt>
However, this plan will have a negative effect on the chocobo's physical attributes, as no strenuous exercise is involved.<Prompt>
If the chocobo has good discernment, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo does not have good discernment, then you shouldn't push it too hard.<Prompt>
Interacting with other chocobos in the field will improve the chocobo's receptivity by fostering its communication skills.<Prompt>
But because the focus is on communication and not exercise, this plan will have a negative effect on the chocobo's physical attributes.<Prompt>
If the chocobo has good receptivity, this plan is quite effective, but if the chocobo does not have good receptivity, then you shouldn't push it too hard.<Prompt>
You can choose to have your chocobo help deliver packages. Not only will this improve its physical attributes, but you will even receive payment for your services!<Prompt>
The downside is that your chocobo's mental attributes, energy, and affection will decrease. You must care well for your chocobo, or you might find yourself getting cold treatment.<Prompt>

You can choose to exhibit your chocobo to the public, which will allow anyone visiting the chocobo stables to take a look at your animal. Being the center of attention will help improve your chocobo's mental attributes.<Prompt>
The downside is that your chocobo's physical attributes, energy, and affection will decrease. You must care well for your chocobo afterwards. Also, you will receive payment for this service.<Prompt>
You can choose to have your chocobo deliver official messages for the nation. Not only will this improve its strength, but you will even receive payment for your services!<Prompt>
However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.<Prompt>
You can have your chocobo help out VCS finances by digging for treasure. This will also improve the chocobo's discernment.<Prompt>
The VCS will sell the item and use the money for the organization's benefit, but will provide you with payment for your services.<Prompt>
However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.<Prompt>
You can choose to have your chocobo act as an extra in a play to improve its receptivity.<Prompt>
You will receive payment in accordance with the chocobo's performance. However, this plan consumes quite a bit of your chocobo's energy, so you should feed it well to make up for it.<Prompt>
What would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>A general explanation. Watching over your chocobo. Telling a story. Scolding. Competing. Taking a walk. Nothing.<Prompt>
In addition to setting the chocobo's schedule, you can also care directly for your chocobo whenever you like.<Prompt>
Caring for your chocobo will increase its affection for you.<Prompt>
On the other hand, a chocobo that receives too much care will lose energy more rapidly when engaging in activities. If you do nothing but care for your chocobo, it will become fatigued.<Prompt>
However, not caring enough for your chocobo will have a negative effect on your relationship, so it is important to find a balance.<Prompt>
You can watch over your chocobo whenever you like.<Prompt>
Your fond gaze can communicate even more than a touch and will not have a very tiring effect on the animal.<Prompt>
You can tell the chocobo a story you know. This will foster the animal's sensibilities.<Prompt>
I've heard that by listening to the story, the chocobo might even realize it has powers it never noticed before. (I've never seen it happen before, though...)<Prompt>
Sometimes your chocobo might start acting spoiled or refuse to do anything but sleep. In such times, you will need to firmly scold it.<Prompt>
This will shame the animal and have an effect on its receptivity.<Prompt>
Competing against other chocobos will cultivate your animal's ambitious spirit and is highly effective for bored chocobos.<Prompt>
You can take your chocobo out for a walk in the field. You will be able to choose more destinations as your chocobo grows.<Prompt>
I like to take the chocobo out often, too, but I'm sure it prefers going out with you.<Prompt>
Leaving the stables every once in a while allows your chocobo to experience new sights and sounds. Maybe you'll even discover something new together!<Prompt>
What would you like to know about. <Selection Dialog>Why feeding is important. Vegetables. Wildgrasses. Carrots. Worms. Medicines. Pastes. Nothing.<Prompt>
Chocobos digest feed quickly, so they are often hungry.<Prompt>
However, they also restore energy at a rapid pace. If you do not feed your chocobo properly, it will be unable to restore enough energy.<Prompt>
The chocobo stables will provide your chocobo with the minimum amount of feed required for the animal to survive, but you need to provide more in order to ensure its healthy growth.<Prompt>
At the same time, feeding your chocobo too much can result in a stomachache. Remember to strike a balance with both the variety and quantity of feed you give to your animal!<Prompt>
Some types of feed have special effects, so it is important not to neglect your chocobo's diet if you want to raise a good chocobo.<Prompt>
There are different methods of acquiring these special types of feed, so be on the lookout for them!<Prompt>
Just <Set colour #5>trade<Set colour #1> the feed to an advanced chocobo trainer, and they will give it to your chocobo.<Prompt>
This is the standard variety of chocobo feed, among which <Possible Special Item>   are most popular.<Prompt>
Chocobos also seem to enjoy <Possible Special Item>   and <Possible Special Item>  .<Prompt>
These greens are the most effective in satisfying a chocobo's hunger. Chocobos also enjoy the taste, which raises affection for their owner.<Prompt>
Wildgrasses are a type of medicinal herb. They do not taste very good, but are highly effective at curing status abnormalities.<Prompt>

<Prompt>.<Possible Special Code: 01><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , for example, works well on wounds. So although they look similar to <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , the effects are different.<Prompt>

In addition, <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   is effective for illness, and <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   for a stomachache. It's a good idea to remember which herb to use in each situation.<Prompt>
Carrots are high in nutrition, and will have an effect on the chocobo's strength and discernment.<Prompt>

<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>  , for example, affect the chocobo's physical attributes, and <Possible Special Item>   are good for its mental attributes. <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>   are in a category of their own.<Prompt>
Remember, though, that the results are very slight, and keeping a good care schedule is a far more efficient way to alter your chocobo's attributes.<Prompt>
Using worms as feed can have a variety of effects. They might look disgusting, but their effectiveness is not to be ignored!<Prompt>

For example, <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   will dramatically increase your chocobo's affection, and <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   will restore its energy.<Prompt>
But watch out for the side effects... Give the chocobo a worm at the wrong time, and all your effort could come to nothing...<Prompt>

The most curious of all the worms is the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  . At first it may not seem to have any effect, but looks are deceiving...<Prompt>
Medicines can cure a chocobo in the blink of an eye.<Prompt>

<Prompt>.<Possible Special Code: 01><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   will restore your chocobo's energy in full, making it easier to care for and ensuring that the care schedule goes smoothly.<Prompt>

<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Possible Special Item>   are effective for most status abnormalities, restoring instant health to your chocobo. Of course, you still need to continue caring for your chocobo so it can fully recover.<Prompt>
A potion can also help fill a chocobo's stomach, so they can be useful when you are short on feed.<Prompt>
Feed can be ground into paste for chicks to eat.<Prompt>
You can make paste yourself with some cooking skill. If you don't have enough cooking skill yourself, then you might want to ask a friend to make some for you.<Prompt>
Chicks can also eat regular feed, though.<Prompt>
Which would you like to ask about. <Selection Dialog>Abilities. Temperament. Weather preferences. Nothing.<Prompt>
Your chocobo may learn useful abilities during the course of its life at the stables.<Prompt>
For example, Auto-Regen will increase the rate at which your chocobo restores energy. Such an ability is sure to come in handy in a variety of situations.<Prompt>
Your chocobo learns abilities by listening to your words, so if you know of any story that you think might interest the animal, you should tell it often.<Prompt>
But remember, your chocobo can't learn all of the abilities there are. It can only learn two...or at least, that's what I read.<Prompt>
The chocobo's temperament is determined when it is just a chick. Its temperament and attributes are somehow related, but I'm not really sure how.<Prompt>
Chocobos generally like sunny days, but they could grow to like other kinds of weather depending on how they are raised.<Prompt>
Chocobos pay attention to the air outside when they go on walks, and grow to prefer that type of weather because of the memories.<Prompt>

Make the animal's schedule around its preferred weather days, and plans are more likely to succeed. However, if the chocobo has a favored type of weather, it also dislikes certain conditions, creating a weak point to watch for.<Prompt>
You can choose to retire your chocobo at any time after it has fully matured.<Prompt>
After retirement, the VCS will take up caring for the chocobo where you left off, so you need not worry about its welfare.<Prompt>
When your chocobo retires, you will receive <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  . Be sure not to lose it.<Prompt>

The empty stall created after your animal retires can be used for raising other chocobos, so if you happen to come across another egg, you can bring it here to start all over again!<Prompt>
When your chocobo is mature enough, you can breed it with another chocobo. If the chocobo lays an egg, the chick will inherit the traits of its parents.<Prompt>

You will need <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   and <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   if you want to breed your chocobo. I don't really know that much about it, but you should probably try matching your chocobo up with several different animals and seeing what the results are.<Prompt>
When your chocobo is mature enough, you can call it in the field using <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  .<Prompt>
You need to let a member of the VCS know which chocobo you want to respond to your call, because they must choose a saddle that fits your chocobo's attributes.<Prompt>
That also means that when your chocobo's attributes change or it learns a new ability, you should probably let the VCS member know, too.<Prompt>

When you want to register a retired chocobo to respond to your call in the field, trade <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   to a VCS member.<Prompt>
Also, the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  's power will grow weak after you've used it several times.<Prompt>

What would you like to know about. <Selection Dialog>The promenade. Chocobet centers. The grandstand. Portals. Guides. Nothing for now.<Prompt>
Shops, as well as attendants to assist you in siging up your chocobo for a race, are located on the promenade.<Prompt>
It can be found just south of here.<Prompt>
The promenade itself is split into eastern and western halves, both of which house all of the same facilities. Be sure to stop by and have a look when you get a chance.<Prompt>

Attendants at the chocobet centers are there to assist you with acquiring <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , as well as collecting your winnings.<Prompt>

There are a total of five centers readily available for your convenience, each of which are located near the transportation portals. There are two to the east and west of here, and one just to the north.<Prompt>
All chocobet centers are capable of providing the same services.<Prompt>
The grandstand faces the racetrack itself, and allows spectators to sit and enjoy the races in comfort.<Prompt>
To get there, just follow the red carpet all the way through the betting area. You can't miss it.<Prompt>
The standard admission fee is <Numeric (Parameter 0)> gil. Patrons who possess <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>6   may enter free of charge.<Prompt>

Your <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>3   will become invalid as soon as you leave the grandstand. Reentry will require you to pay an additional admission fee.<Prompt>
This racetrack is equipped with portals to transport our patrons to any of the three nations, as well as Jeuno and Al Zahbi.<Prompt>

As you can see, we are regularly visited by a multitude of race fans, breeders, and jockeys from every realm imaginable. We have therefore relegated each portal to a single destination in an attempt to avoid congestion.<Prompt>
For the same reasons, we ask that visitors refrain from setting up bazaars while here. Violators of this rule will be severely punished. Your cooperation is appreciated.<Prompt>
Guides can be found throughout the premises waiting to assist you.<Prompt>
They can help by transporting you to the location of your choice.<Prompt>
This service is provided free of charge, so please don't hesitate to make use of it.<Prompt>
What would you like to know about. <Selection Dialog>Racing teams. Race rules. Race types. Victory points. Race Progression. That's about it.<Prompt>
A race chocobo's owner or jockey may join one of the three racing teams by registering at the appropriate VCS branch.<Prompt>
Each nation's Team Victory Points are the sum total of all of its members' Solo Victory Points. The Team Victory Point totals are then used to determine the overall weekly standings.<Prompt>
In order to race your chocobo here, we ask that you please affiliate yourself first with one of the three teams.<Prompt>
For details, please check with your local CRA racing center.<Prompt>
The races held here are almost identical to the official and private races held at the other racetracks.<Prompt>
What distinguishes our races is the fact that victories here qualify you to collect larger cash purses, as well as Victory Points.<Prompt>
Eligibility to participate in the higher-level races will require a certain number of Solo Victory Points.<Prompt>
Depending on a team's weekly standings, its members may suffer certain eligibility restrictions. At the same time, they may also be privy to certain benefits.<Prompt>
The teams in second and third place will have the advantage of being allowed more entry positions in any given race, while those of the leading team are restricted.<Prompt>
The leading team will, however, be granted the privilege of selecting higher-quality saddles for their race chocobos.<Prompt>
The CRA reserves the right to impose a handicap system when it is determined that the gap in skill between chocobos is simply too great to make for a fair race.<Prompt>
In such an event, the  less endowed  of the chocobos will be granted certain enhancing effects, such as Haste or Refresh.<Prompt>
Whether handicaps will be enforced or not will be determined after signups are complete. Make sure to keep an eye on your chocobo's settings.<Prompt>
Each race title will include a code, such as C4. This code is the  race grade. <Prompt>
For example, a  C4 Chocobo Race  would indicate a typical grade 4 race.<Prompt>
We have four race grades, ranging from C4 to C1. The lower the number, the higher the grade. This, of course, means larger entry fees, but also more prize money.<Prompt>

No matter which race you enter, upon completion you will be prevented from joining any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time). Higher-grade races carry larger purses, so most racers like to use their opportunities to go after those.<Prompt>
Solo Victory Points will be awarded to you every race, depending on how well you finish.<Prompt>
As your Solo Victory Points accumulate, your chocobo will be able to gain entry to high-grade races.<Prompt>
Should a racer return to the circuit after an absence of four weeks or more, the CRA will be forced to deduct a number of Solo Victory Points.<Prompt>

Only on the rarest of occasions will such penalties be imposed. However, there are some races in which you will be unable to participate if you do not have a certain amount of Solo Victory Points in your possession.<Prompt>
Also, obtaining Solo Victory Points will also grant your nation Team Victory Points.<Prompt>
The three teams are in constant competition with one another, and a weekly ranking system is in place based on Team Victory Point totals.<Prompt>
As a team climbs up in rank, certain benefits will follow. You may see new items available for purchase with chocobucks, preferential treatment at the races, and so on.<Prompt>
Keep in mind that should you change your team affiliation, you will be forced to forfeit any accumulated Solo Victory Points.<Prompt>
We have a total of four races that run in succession.<Prompt>
Each race has its own dedicated signup window. Here there will be four attendants ready to serve all your racing needs.<Prompt>
Even if the race registration at one window closes, registration for the next race will begin immediately at the neighboring window.<Prompt>
Races will be held one after the other, so you'll have plenty of chances to watch and bet. Sit back, relax, and enjoy!<Prompt>
What would you like to hear more about. <Selection Dialog>Race preparations. Signup procedure. Collecting winnings. Signing up for another race. I'm fine, thanks.<Prompt>
There are a few facts that you should know before running in a race.<Prompt>
First of all, you absolutely must be affiliated with one of the three official racing teams. These, as you may already know, are San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst.<Prompt>
Secondly, it is required that your bird be registered as a  race chocobo,  for obvious reasons. No race chocobo, no race.<Prompt>
Thirdly, you will be responsible for providing your own items to be used during the race. The CRA leaves this to the racer's discretion...<Prompt>
All of these services can be provided at any racing center, but to facilitate the registration process it is recommended that you conduct all such affairs at the appropriate branch.<Prompt>
A racing fee is necessary to gain entry into a chocobo race. The racing center will inform you of the cost, so please be sure to pay when signing up for a race.<Prompt>
Also, when signing up to race, you will be able to choose a saddle, as well as the lane in which your chocobo will race.<Prompt>

There are multifarious saddles at the rider's disposal, each of which will affect your chocobo's conditioning. In addition, the types of saddles available will change depending on your team's current ranking.<Prompt>
There are a total of eight lanes, but general conditions for all of them are the same. Feel free to race in the lane of your choice.<Prompt>

Setting these options will complete the signup process. You will then be given <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  , which you will need to exchange later to collect any winnings.<Prompt>

In the event that you should lose or misplace your <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  , you will be unable to collect any prize money, chocobucks, or Victory Points that you may be entitled to. I cannot stress enough how important it is to hold on to it.<Prompt>
The races can be viewed from our grandstand area. Take a seat and cheer on your bird!<Prompt>
You will be eligible for prize money if your chocobo places either first, second, or third.<Prompt>
To collect, simply hand in the <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   you received during race signup at any signup center.<Prompt>
The amount of gil, chocobucks, and Victory Points you qualify to receive will be based upon your bird's placement.<Prompt>
You will lose the right to collect your winnings from a race exactly one week after that race has ended.<Prompt>
After participating in a race, your chocobo will be unable to join any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time).<Prompt>
This pertains only to races held here, and will not affect your eligibility for races held at any other racetracks.<Prompt>
We have implemented these restrictions here as to allow the greatest number of participants' entry into our races. Your patience and understanding are appreciated.<Prompt>
What would you like to ask. <Selection Dialog>What is chocobetting. How do I bet. What are odds. When do I bet. How do I collect winnings. Nothing.<Prompt>
Chocobetting is a form of entertainment where bettors attempt to pick the two birds that will finish first and second in a race.<Prompt>
To make it a bit more interesting, the bettor can then wager on their picks in increments of 100 gil.<Prompt>
Should lady luck smile upon you and your picks hit, you can win prize money, the amount of which is determined by the odds for that race.<Prompt>
For example, let's say that you were to bet ten quills (1000 gil) on Entries No. 5 and No. 7.<Prompt>

And let's say that the toteboard showed the odds for the race at 110 gil. If your picks were to finish as the top two birds, you would be eligible to collect 1100 gil in winnings, for a total profit of 100 gil.<Prompt>
Of course, it goes without saying that should your picks not have the fortune of finishing in the top two places, you will receive absolutely no gil.<Prompt>
The gambler's fallacy is our mantra here at the racetrack! Remember, you are special! Let it ride!<Prompt>
To place a chocobet, you must obtain <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   from the chocobet center. <Prompt>
For any single <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#  , a bettor may purchase up to 999 quills. Each quill costs 100 gil.<Prompt>
We highly recommend that you obtain information on the chocobos you will be betting on before purchasing your ticket. It is always good to know where your money is going.<Prompt>
Odds determine how much gil you will receive in winnings per quill on your chocobet ticket.<Prompt>

Winnings are calculated by taking the total monetary sum of all bets for any given pairing. For example, should ten bettors each place the same 100-quill (10,000 gil) chocobet, the total used to determine the winnings would be 100,000 gil.<Prompt>
It goes without saying that not all bettors will be winners. The money from losing bets is used to pay off the winners.<Prompt>
What this means is that if you place a bet on an unseemly chocobo pairing, or pick two birds without much money riding on them, and are fortunate enough to win, you can make quite a tidy sum.<Prompt>

Toteboards display the odds at both the chocobet center as well as the grandstand. Toteboards have eight columns with the number on top of each column representing one chocobo, and the number to the left of each column representing another. If your bet is for chocobos No. 2 and No. 5, check the #2 column to see how much a 2-5 bet will pay per quill.<Prompt>
The odds are constantly changing right up until the race begins. If the number of bets on a popular chocobo pairing keeps increasing, then consequently the odds will go down.<Prompt>
Even if you place a large bet early on, the odds may still change as time passes. So take your time and consider carefully.<Prompt>
Chocobets can be placed as soon as the signup period for a race has ended. The betting window will close several minutes before the race begins.<Prompt>
Make sure to get your bet in on time. Even if you are in the middle of placing a bet, it will be cancelled if you exceed the allowed time window by even a single second.<Prompt>
Once the race is finished, you can exchange your <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>#   at any chocobet center to collect your winnings.<Prompt>
Without <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   you will be unable to collect your winnings, so make sure not to lose it.<Prompt>

<Prompt>.<Possible Special Code: 01><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   is valid for up to one week (Earth time) after completion of the race for which it was purchased.<Prompt>
Should one week pass, we will be unable to accept the ticket, so it is always best to cash out as soon as possible.<Prompt>

With the establishment of the Chocobo Circuit and the introduction of chocobo races, the hidden talents of a number of chocobos across Vana'diel finally had a venue in which to come to fruition.<Prompt>
As the next step, the CRA recognized these rare and valuable talents, and developed a new, special kind of race to showcase them even more than before!<Prompt>
The Monster Races !<Prompt>
Without the interference of jockeys, breeders can now pit their chocobos head-to-head against a number of monster species in brutal, raw, no-holds-barred racing! <Prompt>

Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele. What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!.<Prompt>
First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.<Prompt>

Next, you must bring me either <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$   or <Possible Special Code: 01> <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>$  . This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.<Prompt>
As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.<Prompt>
Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.<Prompt>

Since these races are geared towards our more veteran racers and will not make use of jockeys, all in-race conduct is based solely on the chocobos themselves. The CRA wants these races to be as pure as possible!<Prompt>

The same philosophy applies to the usage of items as well. Simply preset the items you wish for your chocobo to have at its disposal. It will use them as it sees fit based on real-time assessment of racing conditions.<Prompt>

Many breeders are distressed by these rules, but we assure you there is no need for concern. If your chocobo has progressed far enough in the Chocobo Circuit to even be participating in the Monster Races, it is a given that it has enough know-how to use its items wisely. Have faith in your bird.<Prompt>

Also, as with other races in the past, you will be able to check on the strengths and weaknesses of your opponents at this service area. Many breeders like to use this information for developing their race strategies, and we encourage you to do the same.<Prompt>
Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint <Set colour #5>chocobucks<Set colour #1>.<Prompt>
Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.<Prompt>
Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.<Prompt>
There are two main types of races.<Prompt>
The first type is called an <Set colour #5>official race<Set colour #1>. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.<Prompt>
Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.<Prompt>
You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.<Prompt>

However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.<Prompt>

The second type of race is called a <Set colour #5>free run<Set colour #1>. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match. In addition, you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance.<Prompt>
You are not able to sign up for free runs at this location. To do so, please visit the appropriate service area for beginning and intermediate racers. Thank you for your understanding.<Prompt>
The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.<Prompt>
Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.<Prompt>
Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.<Prompt>
In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.<Prompt>
You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.<Prompt>
Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).<Prompt>
Your opponents in the official monster races will be any of a host of beasts reared and trained by racing aficionado and announcer extraordinaire, Markovich.<Prompt>

We ensure all participating breeders that these monsters are in no way enhanced or engineered for racing excellence. The CRA has been adamant about maintaining race participants to as close to their natural state of being as possible.<Prompt>
Though each variety of monster does in fact possess characteristic abilities and traits. And they have undergone extensive training to optimize their use of these in races.<Prompt>

As with the chocobos, however, the monsters will be absent jockeys of any kind. It is possible, and expected, that they will often unleash their wild, animalistic instincts on the racetrack. Consider yourself warned.<Prompt>

In the spirit of drawing crowds, the CRA has also elected to place some of their finest birds on the racing roster as well. Breeders can also expect to see other superior-class chocobos taking part. It's going to take a lot more than just speed and endurance to win these races!<Prompt>

Finally, in the absence of jockeys, finish-line sensors will be employed. These devices will be attached to the contestants' ankles, or in the absence of ankles, some other such appropriate place.<Prompt>

Just as their name implies, search comments are original messages composed by adventurers which are readily visible to others when using the search function.<Prompt>
There are several different categories of search comments. These include, but are not limited to,  EXP Party,   Items,  and  Missions and Quests. <Prompt>
Opening the  Search  function from the Main Menu and then selecting the  Comment  option will allow you to conduct a player search by comment type.<Prompt>

Skillchains are devastating elemental phenomena which manifest themselves when weapon skills are carried out in a precise and well-timed order. <Prompt>
The very natures of the skillchains themselves differ widely, being dependent upon the weapon skills used and the order of their execution.<Prompt>
To take a simple and timeless example, using the weapon skill  Red Lotus Blade  immediately after  Fast Blade  will yield a type of skillchain known as  Liquefaction. <Prompt>
Furthermore, adding a  Combo  after the liquefaction effect will produce a more advanced  Fusion  skillchain.<Prompt>
In the taxonomy of skillchains, each type is related to one or more specific elements. Liquefaction is bound to the element of fire, for example, and fusion to both fire and light.<Prompt>
Another crucial point, which I simply cannot emphasize enough, is the importance of timing in the execution of skillchains.<Prompt>
One must not be too overzealous, but too much patience can also be damning. It is most ideal to time the latter weapon skill to begin just a second or two after the preceding one is complete.<Prompt>

The possible weapon skill sequences and the different skillchains they yield are highly variegated. It is said of this time-tested battle art that it  takes a moment to learn, and a lifetime to master. <Prompt>

Magic bursts are another type of supernatural phenomena which occur after carefully selected and impeccably timed spells are cast following a skillchain. Such spells exceed their typical counterparts in that they are enhanced in both power and accuracy. You will commonly see magic bursts abbreviated as  MB. <Prompt>
Magic bursts will not take place if the element of the spell being cast does not match the element of the skillchain preceding it.<Prompt>
To take an example, a detonation skillchain, which has wind as its element, followed by an aero or other like spell, will generate a magic burst.<Prompt>
In the same vein, thunder, or any cognate spell, would result in a magic burst should it follow an impaction skillchain, itself deriving power from that very element.<Prompt>

As I said previously, some skillchains are associated with more than one element. Take fragmentation, for example. It is composed of equal parts wind and thunder. So chasing a fragmentation skillchain with any type of aero or thunder spell would create a magic burst.<Prompt>
The key to mastering magic bursts lies in learning the elemental attributes of both the skillchains you create as well as the magic you wield. The rest is simply a matter of timing.<Prompt>
For your convenience, I will go over the elemental attributes of all skillchain types. Pay close attention.<Prompt>

Level 1 Skillchain (Associated element): Transfixion (Light), Liquefaction (Fire), Detonation (Wind), Impaction (Thunder), Induration (Ice), Reverberation (Water), Scission (Earth), Compression (Darkness).<Prompt>
Level 2 Skillchain (Associated elements): Fusion (Light/Fire), Fragmentation (Wind/Thunder), Distortion (Ice/Water), Gravitation (Earth/Darkness).<Prompt>

You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis. It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.<Prompt>

Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results. The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.<Prompt>

This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call  fewell.  To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!<Prompt>

As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require. Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.<Prompt>

With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing! Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. From here, it becomes a race against the clock! Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.<Prompt>

Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task. First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.<Prompt>

Next, you can begin to <Set colour #5>feed fewell<Set colour #1> into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration. Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.<Prompt>

However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions. Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.<Prompt>

Atmacite is best described as the crystalline agglomeration of a creature's soul. Our scientists have succeeded in discovering a way to tap its power to serve the efforts of the Voidwatch.<Prompt>
By infusing one's body with atmacite, it is possible to obtain powers akin to those once possessed by the creature whence it came, rather like turning a beast's fangs upon its own kind.<Prompt>

At first glance, atmacite appears to be the perfect artificial enhancement. However, it does suffer from a single limitation: its power is unleashed only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.<Prompt>
Research to identify the exact reason for this continues, but most scientists find the spectral alignment theory compelling.<Prompt>
That is, being formed of Voidwalker souls, atmacite will surge to life only when its bearer is existentially aligned to its dimension of origin.<Prompt>
From this it can be inferred that Voidwalkers are stripped of considerable strength when they cross over into Vana'diel.<Prompt>
But I suspect this is of little interest to a layman like you. Allow me to return to the subject at hand.<Prompt>
The infusion of atmacite requires cruor, a potent energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.<Prompt>
Cruor is obtainable by various means, felling a Voidwalker being the most common of all. As you can never have too much cruor, I urge you to be diligent in its procurement.<Prompt>
We've recently perfected a method for improving atmacite potency. The process is called enrichment, and involves fusing cruor on to atmacite to amplify its power.<Prompt>

Atmacite can be enriched in stages up to a maximum of level <Numeric (Parameter 0)>. The quantity of cruor required varies with the variety of atmacite as well as its current enrichment level.<Prompt>

Under normal conditions, atmacite enrichment is an intensive process that demands trained hands. For reasons yet to be determined, however, both infusion and enrichment can be safely performed by laymen, provided they're at a planar rift.<Prompt>
Keep this in mind should the need arise to reconfigure your atmacite with haste.<Prompt>

Voidwalker  is the name given to creatures that roam the realm between worlds.<Prompt>
Little is known about them at this time, except that they're driven by an insatiable lust for destruction.<Prompt>
While reports of Voidwalker encounters vary greatly in content, one thing is certain: the creatures are gaining in strength, a mounting threat that cannot be left unchecked.<Prompt>
In our effort to neutralize the Voidwalker menace, the Voidwatch is petitioning adventurers to lend their aid.<Prompt>
As the nature of Voidwalker battles renders full-scale military operations unfeasible, we have chosen to stake our success on the mobility and versatility of adventurers.<Prompt>
In our effort to neutralize the Voidwalker menace, the Voidwatch is petitioning soldiers of the Allied Forces to lend their aid.<Prompt>
To be sure, there're those who question the wisdom of thinning our ranks in the face of the Shadow Lord's armies. But I assure you, friend, the Voidwalker threat is no less real.<Prompt>
Our scouts regularly bring back intel on locations of suspected Voidwalker presence.<Prompt>
Armed with this information, we dispatch strike teams to preemptively neutralize the threat.<Prompt>
Ordinarily, Voidwalkers cannot be seen, let alone fought. Only by using the voidstone's power can we force them to feel the sting of our steel.<Prompt>
These magicked stones are distributed in regular shipments from our Jeuno-based research team. They're the bare minimum we need to have a fighting chance against the enemy.<Prompt>
Voidstones work by realigning your existential spectrum to match that of Voidwalkers, thus rendering the creatures visible to you.<Prompt>
The stones are highly prized, such is the difficulty of their creation. As such, supplies are limited to <Numeric (Parameter 0)> stones per person at any given time.<Prompt>
That's provided we have any in stock at all. Much time is required in imbuing them with requisite powers.<Prompt>
The Voidwatch is an organization that exists for the sole purpose of protecting the world from extradimensional invaders we call  Voidwalkers. <Prompt>
Recognizing the graveness of this threat, the nations of the Middle Lands joined together in common cause and formed the Voidwatch.<Prompt>
Helming the organization is the Grand Duchy of Jeuno, with the remaining three nations contributing resources for its operation.<Prompt>
Possession of <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>6   is a requirement for participating in Voidwatch Ops.<Prompt>
It can be earned only through loyal service to your nation, and thus serves as a testimonial for your prowess.<Prompt>
You would do well to obtain one if you haven't already done so.<Prompt>
Affiliation with the Allied Forces of Altana is a requirement for participating in Voidwatch Ops.<Prompt>
In other words, you must belong to the armed forces of one of the three nations.<Prompt>
The enlistment procedure varies depending on nation. Those wishing to obtain a recommendation letter should pay visit to one of the military encampments surrounding Jeuno.<Prompt>
When you battle a Voidwalker, you must do so as a  Voidwatcher --a defender of the dimension who has harnessed the powers of the voidstone and stratum abyssite.<Prompt>
Bereft of these two objects, Voidwalkers cannot be seen, let alone fought.<Prompt>
However, there are a few points all budding Voidwatchers should bear in mind.<Prompt>
Most crucial of all, the extradimensional nature of being a Voidwatcher renders you isolated and unable to receive help from the outside world.<Prompt>
Scientists attribute this to the dimensional misalignment that occurs. As people are ordinarily unable to see Voidwalkers, so too are they unable to see you.<Prompt>
But you needn't concern yourself with the hows and whys of such matters. It would behoove you far more to become familiar with the workings of the  existential spectrum. <Prompt>

Don'tcha think dat furrowed brow and cocked head o' yers escaped me. Yer int'rested in dis chest, ain'tcha. Well, ya gots good right tah be, 'cause even us Gobbies is fascimanated wit' it. It's some sorta myst'ry box salvaged from a shipwreck in da Gugru Blue! Da mysterious part is dat what goes in don't necessarilies come out!<Prompt>

While I may tout its amazin'ness, don'tcha think fer even a second dat I's at liberty tah divulge hows we came by it. Still, I likes yer face. It's a kind face, one dat says ya won't stabs me in da back, which is more'n I can say fer my own mum. Lemme shows ya how to use dis myst'ry box.<Prompt>

Bah-dah-bah-dahm dah-daaahm! <Prompt>6<Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)> Ya open da chest. Dat's it. And da kicker be dat I'm da one doin' da openin'. Ya just gets tah stand dere gawkin' in astonishmament. Easy gig, no.<Prompt>
Oh yeah, 'fore I forget. What good's a chest if ya ain't gots da key. Well, da key to dis chest is da fine art o' waitin'.<Prompt>
Ya wantsa know da hows n' da whys. Well da bosses had our tinkers tinkerin' on troo' da night and dey foun' dat...<Prompt>

Well, dey foun' dat we really gots no idea why da loot changes. Anywho, ya's wanna wait 'n wait 'n wait, den keep on waitin' some more. "Good things come tah dose who wait," right. Well, da longer ya wait, da gooder da thing...maybe. Ya just never know wit' a myst'ry box.<Prompt>

Also, I calls da amount o' time ya's waited yer circa...circama...circamadamian...ugh, yer  daily tally.  It ain't just da name dat's catchy, though. Da higher yer tally, da gooder yer goods get! Can't get much good--er, simpler dan dat.<Prompt>
Finally, ya opens da chest. Oooh, I can barely contain m'self thinkin' o' all da riches I--er, ya could have!<Prompt>
Oh, dat's right! Heyheyhey, got any items ya won't be needin'. If so, fork 'em over 'n yer daily tally'll increase! Mebbe not by much, but dat's better'n nothin', am I right.<Prompt>

And dere's no better feelin' dan takin' trash and turnin' it into treasure. It's pramactically a new kind o' alchemy! But don't go gung ho 'n overfills da thing 'til its hinges break. Myst'ry boxes don't grow on goobbues, y'know.<Prompt>

Plus, I'll be here tah stops ya if I sees ya stuffin' whole Gobbiebags worth o' possessions in dere, so don't worry yer oversized noggin' over and over over it. Whats was I sayin' again. Ugh, never mind.<Prompt>
Sadly, howsever, anodda myst'ry 'bout dis chest is dat it won't takes just any ol' bauble. It has da taste o' a picky peiste--it feasts upon nothin' but da rarest and unique-est o' artifacts.<Prompt>

Lastly, since we don't knows where da items go once inside, ya ain't gettin' nothin' back datcha put in. Ya reap whatcha sow, and da weather ain't always condusimasive to a good harvest, am I right. My condolemances in advance for any losses ya mights incur from da myst'ry box's fickle nature.<Prompt>
Dat all make 'nough sense tah ya. Just say da woid when ya wanna use my services. I's more'n happy tah help.<Prompt>

Hey! I rem'mber seein' yer foice 'round here. Take a looksie. I's taken' it upon myself tah jigger 'round wit' dese all-new myst'ry boxes, found straight from an ol' capsized vessel in the Gugru Blue.<Prompt>
I's nevah gonna say how we gots our hands on 'em, so dun even ask! But, still, I gots tah say dat dese're somet'in' special! Now try yer hand 'fore I smack ya!<Prompt>
Just select yer desir'd dial and plug 'way at it. Will ya win somethin' super special. Or will't be da booby proize.<Prompt>
Dese're some  special dials,  an' I gots no inklin' what's inside. Ya gots tah open 'em yerself tah find out what treasures lie within!<Prompt>
Oh ho, I's forgettin' tah explain somethin' to ya. See dese  special dials . Dey're super primo, but I still no know wut's gonna be in dere.<Prompt>
So I's not be takin' no responsibility if somethin' weird 'n wacky comes out. Got it. Ya open it, ya keep it.<Prompt>
'N openin' 'em requires some kinda secret technique. Maybe it'll succeed, maybe tha box'll break. 'Sif I know. But ya can only try 'em once a day.<Prompt>
Oho, ya feelin' lucky 'nough tah takes a stab at da myst'ry box.<Prompt>

Unity Concord is a system promulgated and managed by the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network.<Prompt>
Participating adventurers are able to receive a variety of benefits and rewards just by engaging in their everyday activities.<Prompt>
Unity  is a catchall term that refers to the group that participants belong to.<Prompt>
Unity leaders are individuals who have strong ties to adventurers' activities and are sterling representatives of their home nations.<Prompt>

Members of the same Unity can converse with each other over great distances through the use of specialized figurines known as  <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>5  . <Prompt>
Chat settings may be changed by selecting  Status  from the main menu, and choosing  Unity Info  under the  Unity  submenu.<Prompt>
You may not always be able to join the chat if too many players are participating at once.<Prompt>
Those belonging to a Unity are able to undertake special Records of Eminence objectives related to Unity Concord activities.<Prompt>
The three pertinent categories include shared objectives, Unity leader-specific objectives, and Wanted battle objectives.<Prompt>
Shared objectives may be taken regardless of which Unity you have joined. These tasks can be undertaken at any time, and change every day at midnight (JST).<Prompt>
Unity leader-specific objectives are tied to the Unity's eponymous leader and change each week.<Prompt>
Wanted  objectives center around vanquishing particularly heinous foes that terrorize Vana'diel.<Prompt>
These objectives are of a higher caliber, and thus require currency known as  Unity accolades  to undertake.<Prompt>
Shared and leader-specific objectives provide more accolades than run-of-the-mill objectives.<Prompt>
Vana'diel has always been plagued by nefarious foes pillaging the landscape, but relatives of some of the more heinous ones have been spotted lately.<Prompt>
The A.M.A.N. has deemed it necessary to eliminate these Wanted targets, and has notified Unity members that they are of the utmost priority.<Prompt>
A list of these foes can be viewed at any time by selecting the appropriate subcategory under the objectives list.<Prompt>
Unity Concord representatives are able to provide participants with transportation to the areas where these threats can be found.<Prompt>
Though tackling the profane will likely require participation of your allies, the objective can be undertaken so long as at least one person has set the appropriate objective.<Prompt>
When you set the objective and commence the battle, the requisite number of Unity accolades will be deducted from your total.<Prompt>
Successful challengers will be rewarded with special rewards in addition to the normal sparks of eminence.<Prompt>
No Unity accolades will be charged should you commence the battle without having the appropriate objective set, but the rewards you can reap from your efforts will be limited.<Prompt>
You can snatch unparalleled equipment and materials from the slain corpses of Wanted targets.<Prompt>
An A.M.A.N. specialist versed in arcane harmonization has kindly offered to use these materials to bring out the latent potential in such pieces.<Prompt>
One of the Unity guides will be pleased to accept certain combinations of equipment and materials to begin the process for you.<Prompt>
A number of accolades is required for this service, but the precision and accuracy of her methods are without equal, and there is no worry of your equipment being destroyed.<Prompt>
You can use specified materials to add new attributes to equipment that has been upgraded.<Prompt>
Utilizing additional materials after adding an attribute can accumulate Reinforcement Points for the equipment and increase its rank.<Prompt>
Increasing your equipment's rank can boost its attributes, while some equipment can also have additional attributes added later.<Prompt>
Speak to the Unity guides after gathering the necessary materials for your equipment in order to add attributes to it or increase its rank.<Prompt>
The first time you add an attribute to a piece of equipment will require the use of Unity accolades.<Prompt>
It also requires that you first complete a specific Records of Eminence objective.<Prompt>
The work you request will be carried out on-site by a specially trained Unity guide.<Prompt>
Completing Records of Eminence objectives as part of a Unity will reward you with Unity accolades in addition to sparks of eminence.<Prompt>
These accolades not only serve as a symbol of prestige, but can also be exchanged for a variety of services.<Prompt>
Some of these services include purchasing items, securing battle zones for hunting Wanted targets, fees for strengthening equipment, and more.<Prompt>
Please note that you may only exchange a maximum of <Numeric (Parameter 0)> accolades per week (Earth time).<Prompt>
You may switch Unities once during the Unity ranking tabulation period.<Prompt>
This is not a decision to be taken lightly, for switching Unities will cause you to forfeit any benefits you were receiving from your previous one.<Prompt>
This process requires a fair deal of paperwork, and the A.M.A.N. will charge you an accolade fee based on your rank.<Prompt>
However, your valorous deeds remain wherever you choose to go, and you will not lose any other accolades.<Prompt>
Rankings are decided through the combined efforts of each of the Unity's members.<Prompt>
The A.M.A.N. tabulates all the good deeds done during a period of time and confers benefits on a Unity for the following ranking period.<Prompt>
Some of these benefits include changes to Unity accolades gained and the effects of equipment earned from Wanted battles.<Prompt>
Yes, you read that correctly--the attributes of certain equipment will increase in line with your Unity's ranking.<Prompt>
On the other hand, members of a Unity that finds itself on the lower rungs will enjoy an increase in accolades and capacity points earned to help bring them up to par.<Prompt>

Additionally, an individual's evaluation is the sum of the accolades they have earned divided by <Numeric (Parameter 0)>. A Unity's ranking is the average of all eligible members' individual evaluations.<Prompt>

The A.M.A.N. does not look kindly on those who only seek to siphon rewards from others' hard work, and thus only confers these boons on those who have collected at least a certain number of accolades.<Prompt>
Unity leaders may also join you as alter egos for a limited period of time.<Prompt>
Those with evaluations of <Numeric (Parameter 0)> or greater will be able to call forth an alter ego of their leader to assist them in battle.<Prompt>
Those eligible will be able to use the alter ego from the moment they acquire the appropriate ranking level until the tabulation after the next.<Prompt>
A leader's alter ego grows in power the higher their Unity is ranked.<Prompt>
Changing Unities will remove the player's ability to call forth their leader's alter ego at the moment they leave their current Unity, regardless of personal evaluation or remaining time.<Prompt>
A player will have to work hard in their new Unity and acquire a sufficient evaluation to regain the ability to call forth their new Unity's leader.<Prompt>
It goes without saying that players must first have acquired a Trust permit in order to avail themselves of this opportunity.<Prompt>
Those desiring to participate should seek out one of the initiative's representatives, dressed in green, in one of the three nations.<Prompt>
